title: Ruud Gullit
summary: Ruud Gullit (Dutch pronunciation: [ˈryt ˈxʏlɪt] (listen);[5] born Rudi Dil; 1 September 1962) is a Dutch footballer and subsequent manager who played professionally in the 1980s and 1990s as a defender, attacking midfielder, midfielder or forward. Widely regarded as one of the best players of his generation, he captained the Netherlands national team that was victorious at UEFA Euro 1988 and was also a member of the squad for the 1990 FIFA World Cup and Euro 1992.
